cheatsheet.title: Create a new regular expresion pattern

intro.description: Regular patterns are different to SQL patterns. For example, if you search strings starting with 'S', the regular pattern is 'S.*', as opposed to 'S%'. Please refer to your Database Management System documentation for further details.

item.title: Set regex pattern information and content
item.description:
To open the New Regex Pattern creation wizard, expand the Libraries node and the Patterns folder on the DQ Repository Tree view. Right click Regex and then select New Regular Pattern on the context menu. The wizard prompts you to provide the Regex pattern metadata (name, purpose, description and expression...). Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can modify or add to the pattern metadata or definitions.
Click Pattern Definition to expand the corresponding view. In this section of the editor, you can create database specific pattern definitions. Select the database type from the list and enter the expression in the corresponding field. If you click the Test button to the right of the expression, the pattern Test Area opens to the right of the studio. Here, you can test character sequences against the pattern.
